How to Install 4pane on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • 4pane

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install 4pane on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing 4pane on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall 4pane in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install 4pane, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install 4pane Using apt

To install 4pane in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install 4pane using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install 4pane

The installation of 4pane might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install 4pane Using apt-get

To install 4pane using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install 4pane.

sudo apt-get -y install 4pane

Install 4pane Using Synaptic

To install 4pane using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install 4pane on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for 4pane. This will display the 4pane package in the package window, now to install 4pane, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the 4pane package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of 4pane.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install 4pane Using aptitude

To install 4pane on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of 4pane.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install 4pane using the command aptitude install 4pane.

sudo aptitude -y install 4pane

How to Upgrade 4pane on debian

If you want to upgrade the 4pane package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade 4pane using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade 4pane to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade 4pane.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade 4pane sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade 4pane

Upgrade 4pane using Aptitude

To upgrade 4pane using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade 4pane.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade 4pane

Upgrade 4pane using Synaptic

To upgrade 4pane using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for 4pane, now right-click 4pane, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade 4pane just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall 4pane on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall 4pane from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just 4pane, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove 4pane

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of 4pane

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of 4pane you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge 4pane

Remove 4pane using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall 4pane using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for 4pane, right-click the 4pane package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall 4pane click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install 4pane on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade 4pane using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of 4pane then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
